intro: Barleria albida, commonly known as the white barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Barleria albida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
